definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Many believe that is posturing on Buck's part but Arsenal are digging their heels in.
sentences.chinese: 很多人认为这是在故作姿态，但阿森那还在固执着。

sentences.english: His concern for the poor is a mere pose.
sentences.chinese: 他关心穷人只是故作姿态罢了。

sentences.english: Posturing by the govt. . Why are steps not taken with the Chinese?
sentences.chinese: 政府在故作姿态，为什么就不对中国人采取措施？

sentences.english: Mr. Ford's indifference to his competitors is no pose.
sentences.chinese: 福特先生对竞争对手的漠不关心并非故作姿态。

sentences.english: She loves to pose when men are around.
sentences.chinese: 当有男人在四周时她喜欢装腔作势，故作姿态。

sentences.english: Her refusal was merely a deliberate gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她的拒绝只是故作姿态。

sentences.english: He suggested that mere gestures toward the opposition were not enough.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，故作姿态的反抗方式是不够的。

definition: to put on an attitude/to pose
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to show off/to make a display of
to say sth without meaning it (idiom); to speak tongue in cheek/saying one thing but meaning sth different
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
